Dianne Feinstein was an outstanding public servant, and her voice and advocacy will be sorely missed. Jan and I send our thoughts and prayers to her friends, family, and staff during this sad time.
She was a champion for gun violence prevention issues and was a tireless advocate for keeping our communities safe. Her legacy will never be forgotten.

Dianne and I worked together to improve the lives of the people of in our state, particularly on the Northern California Coastal Wild Heritage Wilderness Act that protected hundreds of thousands of acres to ensure these pristine lands will be enjoyed for generations to come.
As chair of the Senate Judiciary Committee and Intelligence Committee, she tirelessly fought for our country, no matter how difficult the challenge or complex the issue.

Dianne earned & held the love and trust of her constituents and her colleagues because of her work ethic, knowledge of issues, and her willingness to work across the aisle. She studied the issues to ensure she was making the most informed decision possible for her constituents.

Dianne broke many glass ceilings, from serving as the first female president of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors, the first female mayor of San Francisco, to the first female senator from our state. She was a trailblazer in every meaning of the word.

Senator Feinstein was a legendary & iconic public servant and a champion for CA and our nation. She put her heart and soul completely into serving her beloved San Francisco, California, and the US. We owe her a debt a gratitude for all of her incredible work.

As we mark the 2 year anniversary of this dark day in our history, let us remember the importance of protecting & defending our democracy & our Republic. 

Protecting our democracy means protecting our nation, and I'm committed to ensuring the will of the people is always upheld.
These efforts pose a significant threat to the stability and integrity of our nation, and it is incumbent upon all of us to work together to counter them.

However, the threat to our democracy did not end on January 6. 

In the two years since the attack, we have seen conspiracy theories and disinformation campaigns aimed at sowing division and undermining the legitimacy of representative government.

It is a testament to the resilience of our democracy that, despite this attack, the will of the people was upheld, and the peaceful transition of power was completed. 

Our democracy and our Republic are too important, and this attack reminded us just how fragile they can be.

January 6 was a tragic day in our nation’s history, and it’s one that has never been witnessed before. 

It is essential that we reflect on the events of that day and the impact they had on our nation, as those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.

🧵 Two years ago, our Capitol was assaulted by those seeking to overturn the will of the people. 

It was a blatantly illegal attempt to subvert our elections and prevent the peaceful transfer of power, which is a cornerstone of our democracy.
